alert.note: Alert for Beckham; Custer; Roger Mills (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 15 at 7:06PM CDT until June 15 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Roger Mills County in western Oklahoma... Southwestern Custer County in western Oklahoma... Northern Beckham County in western Oklahoma... * Until 730 PM CDT. * At 706 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of Angora to 6 miles southeast of Allison, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. * Locations impacted include... Elk City, Sayre, Cheyenne, Hammon, Reydon, Sweetwater, Strong City, Delhi, Foss Reservoir, Berlin, and Dempsey. TORNADO...POSSIBLE THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Remain alert for a possible tornado! Tornadoes can develop quickly from severe thunderstorms. If you spot a tornado go at once into the basement or small central room in a sturdy structure. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect for the warned area.
